News.Title: Mazagon Dock Announces ₹7.5 Interim Dividend
News.Summary: Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders declares second interim dividend of ₹7.5 per share, demonstrating strong financial performance and commitment to shareholder returns.

News.Title: Mazagon Dock Q3 Net Profit Rises 8.6% to ₹8.8B
News.Summary: Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders reports consolidated net profit of ₹8.8 billion for Q3, up from ₹8.1 billion year-on-year. Revenue increased to ₹36 billion from ₹31 billion in the same period.

News.Title: Mazagon Dock: $10B Germany Submarine Deal Approved
News.Summary: Government agreement clears path for Mazagon Dock's major $10 billion submarine deal with Germany, marking significant defense sector development for the shipbuilder.

News.Title: Mazagon Dock Independent Director Resigns
News.Summary: Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders announces resignation of Independent Director Shri Chandu Sambasiva Rao effective January 23, 2026, citing personal circumstances.

News.Title: Mazagon Dock Completes 41.73% Stake Acquisition in CDPLC
News.Summary: Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders has successfully acquired 16.49 crore shares representing 41.73% stake in Colombo Dockyard PLC through unsubscribed rights shares allotment, with mandatory offer process underway.

News.Title: Mazagon Dock Clarifies On $8B Submarine Deal Reports
News.Summary: Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders clarifies media reports about India-Germany submarine deal talks, confirms ongoing P75(I) negotiations while stating no awareness of other material developments mentioned in news reports.

News.Title: Mazagon Dock in talks for $8B German submarine deal
News.Summary: Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders confirms ongoing discussions with Germany regarding a significant $8 billion submarine contract, with no other major developments currently reported by the company.

News.Title: Mazagon Dock clarifies P75(I) submarine deal talks
News.Summary: Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders confirms ongoing negotiations with Indian Navy for P75(I) submarine project following media reports of India-Germany $8 billion submarine manufacturing deal discussions.

News.Title: Mazagon Dock jumps 5% on ₹72,000 cr submarine deal
News.Summary: Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders shares surge over 5% to ₹2,606.95 after reports of India-Germany finalizing $8 billion submarine agreement with Thyssenkrupp Marine Systems for domestic manufacturing.

News.Title: Defence stocks surge 6% led by Mazagon Dock gains
News.Summary: Defence shares climbed up to 6% despite weak markets on January 9, driven by Trump's $1.5 trillion defence budget proposal, potential $8 billion India-Germany submarine deal, and Greenland tensions.

News.Title: India-Germany $8B submarine deal may boost Mazagon Dock
News.Summary: India and Germany are reportedly finalizing an $8 billion submarine manufacturing deal that could become India's largest defence agreement, with potential implications for Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders.

News.Title: MDL shares in focus on $8bn Indo-German submarine deal
News.Summary: Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders shares expected to gain attention as India and Germany advance talks on $8 billion submarine manufacturing deal with technology transfer provisions.

News.Title: Mazagon Dock Eyes Heavy-Crude Tanker Opportunity
News.Summary: Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders assesses shifting oil flows following US-Venezuela developments, while pursuing Rs 15,000 crore dockyard investment and potential Rs 1.5 lakh crore orders.

News.Title: Mazagon Dock Signs MoU with Brazilian & Indian Navy
News.Summary: Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders enters strategic partnership with Brazilian and Indian Navy for Scorpene submarine maintenance and defence cooperation on December 09, 2025.

News.Title: Mazagon Dock Delivers Fourth Project 17A Advanced Stealth Frigate 'Taragiri' to Indian Navy
News.Summary: Mazagon Dock delivered the fourth Project 17A advanced stealth frigate named 'Taragiri' to the Indian Navy, featuring 75% indigenous content and completed within 81 months. The delivery demonstrates the company's defense manufacturing capabilities and contributes to India's naval modernization program.

News.Title: Mazagon Dock Delivers Fourth Advanced Stealth Frigate 'Taragiri' to Indian Navy
News.Summary: Mazagon Dock delivered 'Taragiri', the fourth advanced stealth frigate to the Indian Navy, completed in 81 months with 75% local content. The delivery strengthens India's naval capabilities while supporting the domestic defense manufacturing sector through significant indigenous component integration.

News.Title: Mazagon Dock Reports 27% PAT Growth in Q2 FY26, Eyes Major Defense Orders Worth Over ₹1 Lakh Crores
News.Summary: Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders Limited reported quarterly results with revenue from operations at ₹2,929 crores, up 6% year-on-year. Profit After Tax reached ₹715 crores, marking a 27% increase compared to the corresponding quarter last year. The company's order book stands at ₹27,415 crores. Management expects revenue of approximately ₹12,500 crores for the current financial year with 5% growth anticipated next year. The company is pursuing several major defense projects including P75I submarines (commercial negotiations ongoing), three additional Scorpene submarines (awaiting final approval), and Landing Platform Dock worth ₹35,000-40,000 crores. Mazagon Dock signed an exclusive MoU with Swan Shipyard for the LPD project and is planning a ₹5,000 crore greenfield shipyard in Tuticorin for commercial shipbuilding. The company wrote back liquidated damages of ₹102 crores related to the 17 Alpha second ship. Management projects the order book to exceed ₹1 lakh crores by FY27 and expects stable margins of around 15% for operationally efficient projects.

News.Title: Mazagon Dock Sets Rs 12,500 Crore Revenue Target for FY26, Plans New Tuticorin Shipyard
News.Summary: Mazagon Dock has set a revenue target of approximately Rs 12,500 crores for FY26, anticipating 5% growth next year. The company forecasts margins of 12-15% for new projects, with expectations of higher margins of 25-30% upon project completion after clearing liabilities. Mazagon Dock predicts its order book will surpass Rs 1 lakh crore by FY27. The company is establishing a new shipyard in Tuticorin designed for very large ships up to 300,000 tons, with Phase 1 requiring an investment of Rs 5,000 crores.

News.Title: Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders and Swan Defence Sign Teaming Agreement for Indian Navy Landing Platform Docks
News.Summary: Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders Limited (MDL) and Swan Defence and Heavy Industries Limited (SDHI) signed an exclusive teaming agreement for the design and construction of Landing Platform Docks (LPDs) for the Indian Navy. The agreement was signed during India Maritime Week 2025 in Mumbai. The Defence Acquisition Council approved the acquisition of LPDs for amphibious operations and humanitarian missions. Under the partnership, MDL will contribute ship design, project management, and system integration expertise, while SDHI will provide shipbuilding infrastructure for vessel construction. The collaboration aims to combine public and private sector strengths to reduce build periods, enhance quality, and achieve cost efficiency.

News.Title: Mazagon Dock Targets ₹30,000 Crore Revenue and ₹85,000 Crore Order Book by FY27
News.Summary: Mazagon Dock has set ambitious targets to achieve ₹30,000 crore in annual revenue and ₹85,000 crore order book by FY27. The company's growth strategy includes securing new frigates and submarine orders, expanding through a greenfield shipyard in Tamil Nadu, and participating in the Maritime Amritkaal 2047 naval manufacturing roadmap.

News.Title: Mazagon Dock Recommends Interim Dividend of Rs 6 Per Share
News.Summary: Mazagon Dock has recommended an interim dividend of Rs 6 per share for its shareholders.

News.Title: Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders Reports Strong Q2 Performance with 28% Jump in Net Profit
News.Summary: Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders reported consolidated net profit of 7.49 billion rupees for Q2, up from 5.85 billion rupees in the same period last year. Revenue increased to 29.29 billion rupees from 27.5 billion rupees year-over-year. EBITDA rose to 6.94 billion rupees compared to 5.10 billion rupees previously. The company's EBITDA margin expanded to 23.71% from 18.52% in the corresponding quarter last year.

News.Title: Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders to Announce Q2 Results on Oct 27, Board to Consider Interim Dividend
News.Summary: Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders will release its Q2 and half-year financial results for the period ended Sept. 30, 2025, on Monday, Oct. 27. The Board will also consider declaring the first interim dividend for FY 2025-26. An earnings call is scheduled for Oct. 28 at 4:30 p.m. IST. The company's trading window remains closed until Oct. 29. In Q1 results, the company reported a 35% decline in net profit to Rs 452 crore despite an 11.4% revenue increase to Rs 2,625.59 crore. EBITDA fell 53% to Rs 302 crore with margins narrowing to 11.5%. The stock has declined 4.31% in the past month but gained 25.39% year-to-date, trading at Rs 2,813.60 on the NSE.

News.Title: Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders Schedules Board Meeting for Q2 Results and Interim Dividend Declaration
News.Summary: Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders Limited has scheduled a Board of Directors meeting for October 27, 2025 to consider and approve unaudited financial results for the quarter and half year ended September 30, 2025. The board will also consider declaring the first interim dividend for Financial Year 2025-26. The company has implemented a trading window closure from October 1 to October 29, 2025 for designated persons and their immediate relatives dealing in company equity shares.

News.Title: Mazagon Dock Signs Exclusive MoU with Naval Group for Scorpene Submarines
News.Summary: Mazagon Dock has entered into an exclusive memorandum of understanding with Naval Group regarding Scorpene submarines. The agreement establishes an exclusive partnership between the two companies for submarine-related activities.

News.Title: Mazagon Dock Signs Exclusive Partnership with France's Naval Group for Foreign Submarine Project
News.Summary: Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders Ltd signed an exclusive Memorandum of Understanding with Naval Group, France, on October 16 to jointly offer evolved submarines to a friendly foreign nation as part of an ongoing submarine acquisition programme. This follows their July agreement for technology transfer to install indigenous energy system plugs on Indian Navy's Kalvari-class submarines. The Defence Ministry signed two contracts worth ₹2,867 crore - ₹1,990 crore with Mazagon Dock for air-independent propulsion plug construction and ₹877 crore with Naval Group for electronic heavyweight torpedo system integration. The company's shares closed at ₹2,818.00, down 0.49% on the BSE.

News.Title: Mazagon Dock Signs Exclusive Deal With Naval Group For Scorpene Submarines
News.Summary: Mazagon Dock has entered into an exclusive agreement with Naval Group for Scorpene submarines. The deal establishes a partnership between the two companies in the submarine manufacturing sector.

News.Title: Mazagon Dock Approves Rs 2.71 Final Dividend, Reports 35% Drop in Q1 Net Profit
News.Summary: Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders shareholders approved a final dividend of Rs 2.71 per equity share at the annual general meeting, distributing Rs 109.32 crore to shareholders. The central government, holding 84.8% stake, will receive Rs 93 crore. Payment will be completed within 30 days. This final dividend adds to interim dividends of Rs 23.19 and Rs 3 per share paid during the financial year. The company reported a 35% decline in net profit to Rs 452 crore for the quarter ended June, missing analyst estimates of Rs 695 crore. Revenue increased 11.4% to Rs 2,625.59 crore, while operating income rose 53% to Rs 302 crore with Ebitda margin at 11.5%. The stock closed 2.71% lower at Rs 2,751, despite gaining 31.14% over the past 12 months. Four of six analysts maintain buy ratings with an average price target of Rs 3,144.67.

News.Title: Mazagon Dock Signs Agreement with Tamil Nadu for New Eastern Coast Shipyard
News.Summary: Mazagon Dock has entered into an agreement with the Tamil Nadu government to establish a new shipyard facility on India's eastern coast. This expansion represents the company's strategic move to increase its shipbuilding capacity and geographical presence.

News.Title: Germany's TKMS Begins Contract Negotiations with India for Submarine Project
News.Summary: Germany's TKMS has started official contract negotiations with Indian procurement authorities for a submarine project involving Mazagon Dock. TKMS reported that its order backlog reached EUR 18.5 billion as of June 30, 2025, reflecting an increase attributed to this development.

News.Title: Mazagon Dock Starts Navy Negotiations for ₹70,000-Crore Submarine Project P-75(I)
News.Summary: Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders has begun negotiations with the Indian Navy for the submarine programme Project P-75(I). The Ministry of Defence approved the state-run shipbuilder in August to start cost talks with Germany's Thyssenkrupp Marine Systems for building six conventional submarines in a deal valued at nearly ₹70,000 crore. The contract is expected to be awarded about six months after successful completion of cost negotiations. Under a memorandum of understanding signed in June 2023, Thyssenkrupp will handle engineering and design while Mazagon Dock will construct and deliver the submarines. JPMorgan maintains an 'underweight' stance with a price target of ₹2,468, citing limited positive triggers despite the stock's 30% correction from its peak of ₹3,775. The company's earnings in recent quarters were impacted by provisions related to cost overruns, though management indicated margins are likely to recover. Mazagon Dock will be included in the Nifty Next 50 index from end of September. Shares closed higher by over ₹70 at ₹2,754.85.

News.Title: Mazagon Dock Initiates Discussions with Indian Navy on Submarine Project P75(I)
News.Summary: Mazagon Dock has begun talks with the Indian Navy regarding the submarine project P75(I). The discussions mark the start of engagement between the shipbuilder and the naval force on this submarine initiative.

News.Title: Japan's MOL Shows Interest in Ships from Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders
News.Summary: Japanese shipping company MOL has expressed interest in acquiring Indian-made ships for its fleet from Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders. This represents potential international business expansion for the Indian shipbuilder.

News.Title: India Plans to Finalize ₹1 Lakh Crore Submarine Deals with France and Germany by Mid-2026
News.Summary: India is negotiating two major submarine procurement deals worth over ₹1 lakh crore, expected to be completed by mid-next year. The first involves three Scorpene submarines worth ₹36,000 crore, jointly constructed by Mazagon Dock Limited and French Naval Group. The defense ministry cleared this deal over two years ago, but technical and commercial negotiations have faced delays. The second project involves six diesel-electric stealth submarines costing around ₹65,000 crore under Project 75 India, initially cleared in 2021. German shipbuilder ThyssenKrupp Marine Systems has partnered with Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders for this initiative. Cost negotiations for the stealth submarine deal will begin soon and may take six to nine months. Commercial negotiations for the Scorpene submarines are nearly complete. Delivery of submarines under both projects will start approximately six years after contract signing. The Navy seeks to strengthen its underwater capabilities amid China's growing naval presence.

News.Title: India's Foreign Ministry Reports Naval Discussions with Japan on Ship Maintenance
News.Summary: India's Foreign Ministry has reported that discussions are taking place between the Indian Navy and Japan regarding ship maintenance services. The talks involve Mazagon Dock, which appears to be connected to these naval cooperation discussions between the two countries.

News.Title: Mazagon Dock Clarifies No Current Negotiations on Rs 70,000 Crore Submarine Deal
News.Summary: Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders issued a clarification stating there are no ongoing negotiations with the Defence Ministry for the Rs 70,000 crore Project 75 India submarine contract. This follows conflicting reports from news agency ANI citing Defence officials claiming negotiations had begun. The Defence Ministry selected Mazagon Dock in January to build six submarines with Air Independent Propulsion systems, partnering with Germany's ThyssenKrupp Marine Systems. The companies signed an MoU in June 2023, with ThyssenKrupp handling engineering and design while Mazagon Dock manages construction. Management expects both P-75 additional submarines and P-75(I) contracts to be signed in the current financial year, potentially increasing the order book from Rs 32,000 crore to over Rs 1.25 lakh crore. The company has expanded capacity from six to 11 submarines. Shares closed 2.05% higher at Rs 2,755.70, with the stock up 24.93% over 12 months. Analyst consensus shows a price target of Rs 3,232.5, implying 17.3% upside potential.

News.Title: India Shifts to European Partners for $14 Billion Defence Projects Amid US Economic Pressure
News.Summary: India is partnering with European companies for two major defence projects worth over $14 billion, moving away from US collaboration due to aggressive economic leverage from the Trump administration. The projects include Project 75-I for six Kalvari Class submarines and the Advanced Medium Combat Aircraft (AMCA) program, both targeting 2035 induction. Mazagon Dock And Shipbuilders Ltd. will work with German firm ThyssenKrupp for submarine Air Independent Propulsion systems, while French engine maker Safran will collaborate with DRDO's Gas Turbine Research Establishment for 120KN engines for fifth-generation aircraft. The submarine project will feature over 60% indigenous content, significantly higher than previous projects. The $7 billion engine deal with Safran includes 100% technology transfer for design, development, testing and production. These collaborations are expected to increase Mazagon Docks' order book from Rs 32,000 crore to Rs 1.25 lakh crore. India is also building two nuclear submarines under Project 77 with Russia, valued at over Rs 40,000 crore. The strategic shift aims to protect India's indigenous development programs from potential geopolitical roadblocks, particularly given past delays experienced with US technology transfers during the LCA project.

News.Title: Centre Approves ₹70,000 Crore Submarine Deal for Mazagon Dock
News.Summary: The government has cleared a ₹70,000 crore submarine deal involving Mazagon Dock. The Defence Ministry and Mazagon Dock are set to begin negotiations following this approval.

News.Title: ₹65,000 Crore Grants for Shipping Sector Expected to Receive Approval Soon
News.Summary: Grants worth ₹65,000 crore for the shipping sector are expected to be approved soon. This development was reported by ZEE BUSINESS in relation to Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders.

News.Title: Mazagon Dock Targets 15% EBITDA Margin by FY26 Despite Q1 Profit Decline
News.Summary: Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders is targeting EBITDA margins of 15% in FY26, supported by its Rs 30,000 crore order book which the company plans to execute by 2029. The defense PSU reported a 35% decline in consolidated net profit to Rs 452 crore in Q1FY26 from Rs 696 crore in the previous year, with EBITDA margins contracting to 11.46% from 27.23%. Director Biju George attributed the decline to provisions but stated the provisioning issue is largely resolved, with margins expected to normalize from Q2. The company projects 8-10% normalized revenue growth and expects stronger H2 performance driven by ONGC projects resuming post-monsoon. Mazagon Dock is competing for high-value projects including P-75I submarine orders and next-generation destroyers. The company has no immediate fundraising plans, relying on internal accruals for capital expenditure.

News.Title: Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders Reports Quarterly Financial Results
News.Summary: Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders Limited published its unaudited financial results for the quarter ended June 30, 2025. The company reported total income from operations of Rs 2,915 crore compared to Rs 2,628 crore in the same quarter last year. Net profit after tax stood at Rs 452 crore versus Rs 696 crore in the previous year quarter. Earnings per share decreased to Rs 11.21 from Rs 17.26 in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. The results were approved by the Board of Directors on July 28, 2025, and published in Business Standard and Mumbai Chauffer newspapers on July 30, 2025.

News.Title: Mazagon Dock Shares Drop 3.5% After Quarterly Earnings Miss Despite Antique's Buy Rating
News.Summary: Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders shares fell 3.5% to ₹2,695.5 following disappointing quarterly results. The state-run defence equipment manufacturer reported a 35% decline in net profit and 53% drop in EBITDA compared to the same quarter last year, driven by higher costs and increased provisions. Subcontracting expenses remained elevated despite a 67% sequential decline from the March quarter. Despite the poor results, Antique Stock Broking maintained its buy recommendation with a price target of ₹3,858, citing potential orders for three additional Scorpene submarines and strong order pipeline including P75I and P17B projects. The brokerage reduced its financial year 2026 EPS estimate by 8.3% due to potential delays in order awarding. The stock is currently trading 28% below its record high of ₹3,775.

News.Title: Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders Reports Mixed Q1 Results with Revenue Growth but Profit Decline
News.Summary: Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders reported quarterly consolidated net profit of 4.2 billion rupees, down from 6.6 billion rupees in the same period last year. Revenue increased to 26.3 billion rupees from 23.6 billion rupees year-over-year. EBITDA declined significantly to 3.02 billion rupees from 6.42 billion rupees, while EBITDA margin compressed to 11.49% from 27.25% in the previous year.

News.Title: Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders Stock Falls Ahead of Quarterly Results
News.Summary: Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders shares are trading 1.9% lower at ₹2,830, hitting the day's lowest point before quarterly results announcement. Nirmal Bang estimates show expected revenue decline of 9% year-on-year and 11% sequentially to ₹2,828 crore, while EBITDA is projected to jump 18% from the previous year with margin expansion. Net profit is estimated to grow 5% year-on-year. The company's March quarter performance was impacted by higher expenses, particularly sub-contracting costs which increased nearly 10-fold to ₹590 crore from ₹63.5 crore in the same quarter last year. Despite operational challenges, the defence equipment manufacturer exceeded its full-year revenue growth guidance. The stock has declined 25% from its record high and dropped 13% over the past month.

News.Title: Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders To Announce Q1 Results On July 28
News.Summary: Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders Ltd., a Defence Ministry PSU specializing in naval ships and submarines, will announce its quarterly results for the period ended June 30, 2025, on Monday, July 28. The company's trading window has been closed since July 1 and will remain shut until 48 hours after the results announcement. In its previous quarterly results, Mazagon Dock reported consolidated revenue of Rs 3,174.4 crore, up 2.3% year-on-year, but Ebitda fell 83% to Rs 90 crore and net profit declined to Rs 325 crore from Rs 663 crore in the same period last year. The company's shares have declined 1.78% in the last five trading sessions and 7.30% over the past month, though they have gained 29.87% in six months and 28.98% year-to-date. Shares closed at Rs 2,894.00, down 2.21% on Friday.

News.Title: Mazagon Dock Shares Rise 1.45% on Naval Group Technology Transfer Agreement
News.Summary: Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders has signed an agreement with Naval Group for technology transfer to install indigenous energy system plugs on Indian Navy's Kalvari-class submarines. The company's shares traded at ₹2,962, up 1.45% on BSE, with the stock gaining 29% over six months. Under the agreement, Mazagon Dock will integrate DRDO-developed energy system plugs into Indian Kalvari submarines using Naval Group's Scorpene submarine technology. The integration process, called Jumboisation, involves precision hull cutting and energy plug insertion with Naval Group providing technical oversight and training. The Defence Ministry had previously signed two contracts worth ₹2,867 crore - ₹1,990 crore with Mazagon Dock for AIP plug construction and ₹877 crore with Naval Group for torpedo system integration.

News.Title: LIC Acquires 3.27% Stake in Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders Following Government Stake Sale
News.Summary: Life Insurance Corporation of India has acquired a 3.27% stake in Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders, according to June quarter shareholding data. LIC's name was not present in the March shareholding pattern, indicating either no stake or holdings below 1%. The government recently reduced its stake by 3.6% through an offer for sale, bringing its shareholding down to 81.2% from 84.8%. The number of retail shareholders increased from 6.58 lakh to 7 lakh, though retail shareholding remained steady at 9.34%. Foreign portfolio investor holdings rose marginally to 2.49% from 2.26%. Mazagon Dock shares gained 23% during the April-June quarter, reaching a record high of ₹3,775, but have since declined 21% from peak levels. The stock closed at ₹2,979.7, down 2.2% on Friday.

News.Title: Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders: Aims for Colombo Dockyard Turnaround in 5-6 Years
News.Summary: Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders Ltd. plans to acquire a controlling stake in Colombo Dockyard PLC for up to $52.96 million. The company expects to turn Colombo Dockyard debt-free within 5-6 years. The acquisition, valued at approximately Rs 452 crore, will be completed in 4-6 months through primary subscription and secondary share acquisitions.

News.Title: Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders: Acquires Colombo Dockyard for Rs 452 Crore
News.Summary: Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders Ltd. is acquiring a 51% stake in Sri Lanka-listed Colombo Dockyard PLC for $52.96 million (Rs 452 crore) from Japan's Onomichi Dockyard Co. The acquisition will be through a combination of primary subscription and secondary acquisitions. This move aims to strengthen Mazagon Dock's position in the shipbuilding and ship repair industry.

News.Title: Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders to Acquire Stake in Colombo Dockyard
News.Summary: Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders has approved the purchase of a stake in Colombo Dockyard for up to USD 52.96 million. The acquisition is expected to be completed within 4 to 6 months.
